# ARFrame.SegmentationClass

**Enumeration**

A categorization of a pixel that defines a type of content you use to occlude your app’s virtual content.

## Declaration

```swift
enum SegmentationClass
```

## Overview

ARKit applies the categories defined in this class based on its interpretation of the camera feed’s pixel data. Only people are identified in a camera feed, and therefore the available pixel classifications are either [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/SegmentationClass/person] or [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARFrame/SegmentationClass/none].

## Classifying Pixels

- **ARFrame.SegmentationClass.person**: A classification of a pixel in the segmentation buffer as part of a person.
- **ARFrame.SegmentationClass.none**: A classification of a pixel in the segmentation buffer as unidentified.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Checking for people

- **detectedBody**: The screen position information of a body that ARKit recognizes in the camera image.
- **ARBody2D**: The screen-space representation of a person ARKit recognizes in the camera feed.
- **segmentationBuffer**: A buffer that contains pixel information identifying the shape of objects from the camera feed that you use to occlude virtual content.
- **estimatedDepthData**: A buffer that represents the estimated depth values from the camera feed that you use to occlude virtual content.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
